data.title: Omnisphere won't work in Logic 9
data.meta_description: Hi all, I'm not sure if this topic is in the right place, so apologies to the moderators in advance if it is. I've just bought Spectrasonic's Omnisphere, but after the lengthy installation, I cannot get it to make any sound. It is authorised and all the latest updates have been downloaded and ins...
data.text:
Hi all,

I'm not sure if this topic is in the right place, so apologies to the moderators in advance if it is.

I've just bought Spectrasonic's Omnisphere, but after the lengthy installation, I cannot get it to make any sound. It is authorised and all the latest updates have been downloaded and installed.

It is validated in Logic 9's AU manager (running both in 32 and 64 bit mode), but I cannot get any of the sounds to load or even audition. I also get an error stating:

Notice

Cannot load SoundSource "Dynamic Crystal Gamelan ^" from Directory "Core Library". File Dynamic Crystal Gamelan ^.zmap may be missing or corrupted. Try refreshing the SoundSource Browser.

It isn't just the "Dynamic Crystal Gamelan" i get this message with; it happens on a variety of instruments.

My system specs are more that adequate (see signature) too.

Can anyone suggest anything? I'm pulling my hair out at the moment!

Thanks!

Hi Ski/ Peeb,

Ok, sure. No problem. I've contacted Spectrasonics as well, but I just thought I'd "put it out there" and ask the Logic users here as well, as in the past, everyone here has been really helpful

Yes, the STEAM folder is in the correct default location on my HD (Macintosh HD/ Library/ Application Support/ Spectrasonics) so I'm guessing one of the install DVD's is corrupt.

I'm just getting a bit anxious as this monster wasn't cheap and I'm itching to to use it!

Thanks all!
